snippet: R. Allen Stanford, a Texas financier, was found guilty on 13 out of 14 fraud counts in a scheme that lasted more than two decades.
abstract: Federal jury finds R Allen Stanford guilty on 13 out of 14 fraud counts in connection with a worldwide scheme that lasted more than two decades and involved more than $7 billion in investments; verdict comes three years after Stanford was accused of defrauding nearly 30,000 investors in 113 countries in a Ponzi scheme at Antigua-based Stanford International Bank.
lead_paragraph: R. Allen Stanford, a Texas financier, was found guilty on 13 out of 14 fraud counts in a scheme that lasted more than two decades.

headline.seo: Jury Convicts R. Allen Stanford in $7 Billion Fraud Case
headline.main: Stanford Convicted by Jury in $7 Billion Ponzi Scheme
headline.print_headline: Jury Convicts Stanford of 13 Counts in $7 Billion Ponzi Fraud
